revised_title: Physiological Actions and Antidotes of Colubrine and Viperine Snake Venoms
tldr: The author investigates the physiological actions and potential antidotes of colubrine and viperine snake venoms. They find that the symptoms produced by these venoms are similar to those caused by cobra venom, and that Calmette's antivenin may be effective against them. The study also examines the haemolytic action of the venoms and their effects on blood pressure and respiratory curves.
